meanings.definition: Twisted together in a confused mass.
meanings.sent1: The wires were all tangled up in a mess.
meanings.sent2: Her hair became tangled after playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat got tangled in a ball of yarn and couldn't escape!
meanings.sent4: The branches of the trees were tangled like a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The fishing net was so tangled that it took hours to unravel.

meanings.sent1: She found herself in a tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent2: The project became tangled with conflicting instructions.
meanings.sent3: The detective's investigation became tangled but led to the culprit.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like a tangled knot that couldn't be undone.
meanings.sent5: The negotiations grew more tangled as misunderstandings arose.

meanings.sent1: The vines tangled around the fence posts.
meanings.sent2: The ropes tangled together during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The dancers tangled their ribbons in a graceful display.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can easily tangle when communication breaks down.
meanings.sent5: The threads tangled as she tried to sew the fabric together.
